title: Ultra-modern, Luxury apartments in Mountlavinia
details:
‘The Elysian Residencies’ is an ultra-modern, luxury apartment, Sri Lanka located in the heart of Mount Lavinia’s chic residential are offering you the opportunity to be a part of a truly exclusive neighbourhood.

24 fully-appointed luxury apartment units located in an 8-storied building, with spectacular views of the majestic Indian Ocean offers you absolute luxury and total peace of mind.

The Elysian Residencies is a BOI Approved project designed and developed by renowned architects and structural engineers with many years of industry experience. Each and every facet of the property radiates luxury, convenience and exclusivity.

The high tourism potential and close proximity to the Mount Lavinia beach makes it a viable option to be rented out on short-term basis for leisure or business travellers.

Location
The city of Mount Lavinia today is an absolute beehive, a kaleidoscope of colours and ethnicities. The city features one of the island’s best and most popular beaches and is one of Colombo’s most vital tourist hubs.

Hospitals, schools, higher educational institutes and places of religious worship are aplenty here and the city is also home to some of Sri Lanka’s top retail stores, consumer electronic stores and restaurants.


Bed room
Rest in the lap of luxury as you sink in to dreamland with absolute peace of mind free from the troubles of the world. Our bedroom designs and furnishing are simple yet elegant with the right amount of space and the right amount of class.


Living room
From the floorboards right up to the ceiling, each and every curve and corner of our Apartment units epitomises luxury and style. Each apartment unit features immaculate styling and impeccable finishes - the remarkable combination of an architectural masterpiece with modern amenities.


Bath room
Fully vitreous porcelain fittings, tempered glass and high quality international bathroom accessories adorn the bathrooms which have maximized comfort and space utilization.
